result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Brian D Tennies was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program only after serving one year of confinement on this sentence.
Consecutive to: to any sentence currently being served

superMiscConds.notes: If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not enter establishments whose primary purpose is the sale/serving of alcohol.

Defendant shall not operate any motor vehicle without a valid driver's license and proof of insurance.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment, schooling, or combination of both.

Second Amended Information

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Jack Alan Umpleby.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  PSI author also present.  Clerk: CP.  Discussion re letter submitted by ADA Giernoth on 8-11-15 re previous OWI-2nd being handled incorrectly.  Recess.  Reconvene.  Def moves to withdraw pleas previously entered; State has no objection.  Court puts findings on record re OWI-2nd and allows plea to be withdrawn.  State files and Court reviews 2nd Amended Information w/def.  Def acknowledges prior OWI convictions (6).  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1 as amended.  Court finds def guilty on Ct 1 as amended.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 2; Court so orders.  State previously dismissed and read-in 14TR3129 & 15FO12; these will remain dismissed.  
Presentence report has been received/reviewed; corrections noted on the record.  Court questions PSI author; recommendation does not change even with charge being amended from 8th to 7th OWI.  Statements from def's mother and def's step-daughter.  Argument from State and counsel.  Statement from def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
